about: B.Sc. Computer Technology Undergraduate (CTUG) is a comprehensive academic stream offering three specialized 3-year degree programs: B.Sc. Computer Systems and Design, B.Sc. Information Systems, and B.Sc. Software Systems. These programs are designed to equip students with in-depth knowledge and practical skills in modern computing technologies. The B.Sc. Computer Systems and Design course emphasizes the architecture, development, and optimization of computer hardware and software systems. B.Sc. Information Systems focuses on the application of technology in business and organizational settings, covering topics such as data management, system analysis, and IT infrastructure. Meanwhile, B.Sc. Software Systems prepares students for software development and engineering roles, with a strong foundation in programming, algorithms, and application design. Together, these programs foster analytical thinking, problem-solving, and technical proficiency, preparing graduates to thrive in the dynamic fields of IT, software development, and digital transformation.

csddesc: This branch of study focuses on providing the knowledge and skills necessary to develop new paradigms for the design and development of state-of-the-art software projects by incorporating the technologies of computer science.
csd-peo: Be successfully employed as Software developer and/or accepted into higher education.
Engage in professional development with the ability to progress in the organization.
Adapt to societal changes of industries, lifelong learning and entrepreneurial endeavours.
csd-pso: Analyze, develop and provide solutions to industrial problems in computer domain using programming, data processing and analytical skills.
Apply software application oriented skills to innovate solution to meet the ever changing demands of IT industry.
isdesc: This branch of study focuses on the use of computer technology and information management methods to solve problems, by understanding the gamut of product development and web-based applications.

Function as a responsible professional and to adapt to an ever-changing environment.

is-pso: Provide solutions for the problems of computer and information systems domain, using programming, web scripting and information security skills.

ssdesc: This branch of study emphasizes critical thinking and design considerations involved in software-enabled systems, by acquiring the knowledge and skills of software engineering and development.
ss-peo: Flourish in software profession and/or pursue post-graduation.
Exhibit professional competency and contribute to the intellectual foundation of software engineering discipline.
Live and work as contributing, well-rounded member of society.
ss-pso: Design, develop and manage the problems in the field of software engineering using programming, project management and analysis skills.
Create and provide robust solutions for the complex industrial problems using effective project management skills.
po: Engineering knowledge: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

Problem analysis: Identify, formulate, research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

Design/development of solutions: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

Conduct investigations of complex problems: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

Modern tool usage: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

The engineer and society: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.

Environment and sustainability: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.
Ethics: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.
Individual and team work: Function effectively as an individual.
Communication: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large.
Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work.
Life-long learning:  Recognize the need for and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.

labs.detail: Digital laboratory was established during the year 2006-07. The IC lab provides an opportunity for the students to work on the various digital design circuits like Adders, Subtractors, Multiplexers, Encoders and Decoders etc., with 74XX series. The lab is equipped with digital IC trainer kit ,Digital IC Tester, Breadboards and Various IC series. This lab is very useful for the students to impart basic Hardware Knowledge.
